Module Robotinterface
Package robotinterface.motors

Interface LinearMotor

All Superinterfaces:
Motor
All Known Implementing Classes:
LinearMotorComponent
public interface LinearMotor
extends Motor

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    double getCurrentMotorLength()
    Get the current motor's length.
    double getMaxFlexibleLength()
    Get the maximum possible length value to control.
    double getMinFlexibleLength()
    Get the minimal possible length value to control.
    double getMotorSpeed()
    Get the motor speed – either the default speed or the set speed, if this motor supports flexible motor speeds.
    void setDefaultMotorSpeed()
    Set the motor's default speed.
    void setMotorSpeed​(double motorSpeed, boolean exceptionIfLimitsExceeded)
    Set the motor speed.
    void setTargetLength​(double targetLength)
    Set the target length to which the motor should move.
    boolean supportedMotorLength​(double length)
    Detects, whether the given length is allowed by this motor, i.e. not NaN inside the range of supported lengths

    Methods inherited from interface robotinterface.motors.Motor

    currentSpeedPortion, getCurrentValue, getDescription, getID, getMaxFlexibleSpeed, getMaxFlexibleValue, getMinFlexibleSpeed, getMinFlexibleValue, getSpeed, hasFlexibleSpeed, isMoving, nearlyReached, secondsToTarget, setDefaultSpeed, setSpeed, setTargetValue, supportedValue, waitTargetNearlyReached, waitTargetReached

  • Method Details

    • getCurrentMotorLength

      double getCurrentMotorLength()
      Get the current motor's length.
      Returns:
      current motor length (in cm)

    • setTargetLength

      void setTargetLength​(double targetLength)

      Set the target length to which the motor should move.

      Parameters:
      targetLength - target length (in cm)

    • supportedMotorLength

      boolean supportedMotorLength​(double length)
      Detects, whether the given length is allowed by this motor, i.e.
      • not NaN
      • inside the range of supported lengths
      Parameters:
      length - motor length
      Returns:
      true if allowed

    • getMotorSpeed

      double getMotorSpeed()
      Get the motor speed – either the default speed or the set speed, if this motor supports flexible motor speeds.
      Returns:
      speed in cm per second

    • setMotorSpeed

      void setMotorSpeed​(double motorSpeed, boolean exceptionIfLimitsExceeded)
      Set the motor speed. This is only supported, if this motor supports flexible motor speeds.
      Parameters:
      motorSpeed - speed in cm per second
      exceptionIfLimitsExceeded - if true an exception is thrown if the speed limits are exceeded; if false, the speed is always mapped to the valid range

    • setDefaultMotorSpeed

      void setDefaultMotorSpeed()
      Set the motor's default speed. This method also is successful for motors that to do not support flexible speed.

    • getMinFlexibleLength

      double getMinFlexibleLength()
      Get the minimal possible length value to control.
      Returns:
      minimal length in cm

    • getMaxFlexibleLength

      double getMaxFlexibleLength()
      Get the maximum possible length value to control.
      Returns:
      maximum length in cm
